meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by using magic or drugs.
meanings.sent1: The magician was hocussing the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: She suspected the fortune teller was hocussing her with fake predictions.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the clown hocussing the birthday party guests with silly tricks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was skilled at hocussing unsuspecting victims into giving him their money.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's ability to hocuss people with his spells made him famous in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or tricking someone by using magic or drugs.
meanings.sent1: The hocussing of the audience by the magician was flawless.
meanings.sent2: She uncovered the hocussing scheme behind the supposed miracle cure.
meanings.sent3: The movie plot revolved around the villain's evil hocussing of the hero.
meanings.sent4: The hocussing of the villagers by the witch caused chaos in the town.
meanings.sent5: The hocussing of the jury with false evidence led to an unjust verdict.
